questions.title: EM wave properties and WiFi frequency
questions.subject: physics

parts.text: Microwaves and visible light are two types of electromagnetic wave. Both can be used for communications. Give two properties that are common to both visible light and microwaves.
markScheme: 1 mark: Any two from: they travel at the **same speed** (in a vacuum / at the speed of light); they can travel through a **vacuum**; they **transfer energy**; they can be **reflected / refracted / diffracted / absorbed / transmitted**; they are **transverse**.
1 mark: (Second property from the list above)

parts.text: Name two more types of electromagnetic wave that can be used for communications.
markScheme: 1 mark: Both required — **infrared** and **radio waves** (accept IR for infrared)

parts.text: Wi-Fi uses microwaves with a wavelength of 12.5 cm to link a computer to a router. Microwaves travel through the air at 300 000 000 m/s. Calculate the frequency of the microwaves used to link the computer to the router.
markScheme: 1 mark: Correct unit conversion and substitution: 12.5 cm = 0.125 m; $300\,000\,000 = f \times 0.125$
1 mark: Final answer: **2 400 000 000 Hz** (accept 2400 MHz or 2.4 GHz)

parts.text: A politician commented on the increasing use of Wi-Fi. He said: 'I believe that these systems may be harmful to children.' Suggest what the politician could have done to persuade people that what he said was not just an opinion.
markScheme: 1 mark: **Presented (scientific) evidence / data** (doing an experiment/investigation alone is insufficient)

parts.text: One group of scientists said that there is no reason why Wi-Fi should not be used in schools. These scientists also suggested that there is a need for further research. Why did the group of scientists suggest that there is a need for further research?
markScheme: 1 mark: To find out if there **is a hazard** (or not) / to find out if it is **safe** (accept: not enough evidence to make a decision)

questions.title: Radio waves and gamma rays: similarities and dangers
questions.subject: physics

parts.text: Radio waves and gamma rays both transfer energy. Give three other similarities between radio waves and gamma rays.
markScheme: 1 mark: They travel at the **same speed** (in a vacuum / at the speed of light).
1 mark: They can travel through a **vacuum** (accept: they do not need a medium).
1 mark: They are **transverse** waves (accept: they are electromagnetic waves).

parts.text: Both radio waves and gamma rays are used in medicine. Give one medical use of gamma rays.
markScheme: 1 mark: **(Medical) imaging** (accept PET scan, tracer, gamma camera) or **(medical) treatment** (accept radiotherapy, brachytherapy, gamma knife) or **sterilising** medical equipment

parts.text: Explain why exposure to gamma rays can be harmful but exposure to radio waves is not harmful.
markScheme: 1 mark: Gamma rays are **ionising** but radio waves are not.
1 mark: So gamma rays can cause **mutations** in genes/DNA or can increase the risk of **cancer** (accept: damages/kills cells).

parts.text: Some medical scanners produce radio waves at a specific frequency. Explain how radio waves are produced at a specific frequency.
markScheme: 1 mark: Radio waves are produced by **oscillations** in electrical circuits (accept: alternating current; accept: oscillating electrons in an aerial).
1 mark: The radio waves have the **same frequency** as the oscillations (dependent on first mark).
